code.description: Instrument code, human-readable shortcode used to describe the instrument

settlement_price_property.description: settlement_price_property holds the name of the property in the oracle data that should be used as settlement price. If it is set to "prices.BTC.value", then the Future will use the value of this property as settlement price.

trading_termination_property.description: the name of the property in the oracle data that signals termination of trading

vega.OracleSpecToFutureBinding.title: Oracle Spec To Future Binding
vega.OracleSpecToFutureBinding.description: OracleSpecToFutureBinding tells on which property oracle data should be used as settlement price and which to use the trading terminated trigger

quote_name.description: Human-readable name/abbreviation of the quote name

oracle_spec_for_settlement_price.description: The oracle spec describing the oracle data of settlement price

oracle_spec_for_trading_termination.description: The oracle spec describing the oracle data of trading termination

oracle_spec_binding.description: The binding between the oracle spec and the settlement price

settlement_price_decimals.description: The number of decimal places implied by the settlement price emitted by the settlement oracle

operator.title: Operator
operator.description: Comparator describes the type of comparison.

value.description: value is used by the comparator.

vega.data.v1.Condition.description: Condition describes the condition that must be validated by the

pub_keys.description: pubKeys is the list of authorized public keys that signed the data for this external source. All the public keys in the data should be contained in these public keys.

filters.description: filters describes which source data are considered of interest or not for the product (or the risk model).

vega.data.v1.DataSpecConfiguration.title: Data Spec Configuration
vega.data.v1.DataSpecConfiguration.description: In all types of external data sources we have the same configuration set for meeting requirements in order the data to be useful for Vega - valid public keys and matching filters.

key.description: key is the oracle data property key targeted by the filter.

conditions.description: conditions are the conditions that should be matched by the data to be considered of interest.

vega.data.v1.Filter.description: An oracle spec is a data source spec.message OracleSpec {DataSpec oracle_spec = 1;}  Filter describes the conditions under which an oracle data is considered of interest or not.

name.description: name is the name of the property.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type describes the type of properties that are supported by the oracle engine.

vega.data.v1.PropertyKey.title: Property Key
vega.data.v1.PropertyKey.description: PropertyKey describes the property key contained in an oracle data.
